Dear Wilburi
Thank you for your letter of January 23 relative to
Harry*s appointment#
It is my understanding that Harry agreed to accept
the job at $10,000 a year flat, and it was on this basis thsfc
the Board approved his appointment. I am of the opinion, however,
that we should extend to Harry the courtesy of paying the 1,9%
of his salary which would go to his retirement* He would be
expected then to contribute $% from his $10,000.
As you know, we were prepared to pay considerably more
than this to get the man we wanted and I feel that we are justi¬
fied in making this concession to Harry.
Frank, Burton, and Jim, the other members of the
Executive Committee, should have an opportunity to react to this,
so I am sending them carbons of this letter asking that they
notify me immediately if they have any objections to this pro¬
posal.
^y kindest regards.
